snippet: Some Topeka high school students and their parents said they would rather keep their graduation day just a family affair, and not include Michelle Obama.
abstract: Criticism erupts after Topeka, Kan, school district announces that first lady Michelle Obama will speak at a combined ceremony for five area high schools on May 17 to coincide with the 60th anniversary of the Supreme Court’s Brown v Board of Education decision; some students and parents say their complaints are less about politics and more about wanting to keep graduation day a family affair with enough seats for relatives.
lead_paragraph: Some Topeka high school students and their parents said they would rather keep their graduation day just a family affair, and not include Michelle Obama.

headline.main: Kansas: First Lady’s Visit Draws Criticism
headline.print_headline: Kansas: First Lady’s Visit Draws Criticism

keywords.value: Brown v Board of Education (Supreme Court Decision)
keywords.name: subject
